messages.message: I thought this was intentional as a security tactic to prevent revealing where actual projects exist vs invalid URLs.  We see a similar approach on GitHub that swears that a private repo doesn't exist if you're not signed in or don't have the right access to see it, and plenty of other services do this too.

well we already return a different status code (403 vs 500) if the user doesn’t have access to the project, so even if the frontend shows the same error message, sophisticated users can still tell whether the project exists

i do think it’s helpful for users to know why they can’t access the project - ex: Google Drive will tell you whether you don’t have access to a doc or whether the doc doesn’t exist
